newsitem.title: FRANCE: Metaleurop to cut, then raise capital.
newsitem.headline: Metaleurop to cut, then raise capital.

text.p: French metals group Metaleurop said on Monday it planned to increase its capital by around 600 million francs, with main shareholders Preussag AG and Glencore International subscribing to the share issue.

The company will propose at an extraordinary general meeting on February 28, a halving of the nomial capital by reducing the par value of Metaleurop's existing shares from 50 francs to 25, in order to take account of losses of the previous years.
"Once the reduction in capital achieved, the company will approach the capital market to increase its capital by about 600 million francs," the company said in a statement.

"Both the main shareholders, Preussag AG and Glencore International, with a respective 36 percent and 15 percent shareholding have confirmed their intention to subscribe to the issue," Metaleurop said in a statement with 1995/96 results.
"With this measure, the group will regain its financial flexibility in order to grow in its core business activites," it said.
Metaleurop earlier announced a net attributable profit of 42 million francs for the 1995/96 year, compared to a 122 million loss in the previous year.
